medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain and malaise.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Acute onset of right lower quadrant pain that is sharp, stabbing, and severe in nature, lasting for three days. The patient has chronic constipation at baseline and has not had a bowel movement in approximately one week but has been intermittently passing gas. Urinary incontinence has been exacerbated in the setting of new RLQ pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Left pontine lacunar CVA, bilateral occipital hemorrhage secondary to hypertension, seizure disorder, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, history of DVT, history of small-bowel obstruction, chronic kidney disease stage III, recurrent falls, status post right rotator cuff injury, atrial fibrillation on Coumadin, vocal cord squamous cell cancer, urinary retention, sciatica, osteoarthritis.
medical_history.family_history: Father with myocardial infarction/coronary artery disease who died due to complications of prostate cancer; sister with history of cancer, unsure what type.
